result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Scott Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Loud & Boisterous Behavior, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $350 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any further violent and/or confrontational contact with S. Wilson.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Scott Riley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

RETURN ON WARRANT: Case called @ 1:05 p.m. Defendant Joseph Scott Riley in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Resolution recited by ADA Anderson. The defendant waives the right to be personally present in the courtroom. The defendant admits that a violation of the PPDA has occurred. The Court finds that there was a violation and enters and order vacating the PPDA. The Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. No statement by the defendant. Court orders: 60 days WC Jail - Huber, GT, 2 day CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, N/C/C w/ S. Wilson, DNA sample and surcharge, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Bond previously posted to be applied.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph Scott Riley
Current: 20 Wyldeberry Ln, Oshkosh, WI 54904   (Effective: 12-11-2015)
Prior: 20 Wild Berry Ln, Oshkosh, WI 54904

1:23 pm case called. Defendant Joseph Scott Riley not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on non-appearance of the defendant court issues a warrant, State of Wisconsin. Court also tolls the time of the PPDA pending the defendant being brought in on the warrant.
by USPS - Attempted - Not Known - Unable to Forward
Motion hearing on April 19, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
to Vacate Post Plea Diversion Agreement

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:32 PM: Defendant Joseph Scott Riley in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today and is prepared to resolve matter today but would like to speak with the State on resolution.  Off Record for Def to speak with ADA.  Back of Record at 3:13 pm.  State moves for amendment of Ct 1 w/o Enhancer with 12 mos PPDA.  If successful will call for dismissal.  Def agrees with State's recital.  Defendant advised of right to counsel.  Court accepts voluntary waiver of counsel.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's motion to amend Ct 1 to allege Loud/Boisterous conduct w/o Enh Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and stays JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.    Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA.  Matter stayed for 1 yr.  Cash Bond ordered w/conditions.
